com.soen6441.ui.parallel

Class View

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JPanel
            • com.soen6441.ui.parallel.View
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    EditingScene, GridView, GridViewCell, InspectorView, MainScene, NewMapScene, PlayingScene, SceneDemo, ViewDemo

    public class View
extends javax.swing.JPanel

    Introduction

    A Parallel Class, which represent a view.



    Life Cycle

    Life Cycle - Initialization

    General Idea

    When a view is contructing using the constructor, it will call some hook methods.

    Every subclass of the View should know them, and put the correct code into the right method.

    1. init()

    The constructor first call this method, so every subclass could use this method to initialize some insential properties.

    Getting some thing from model to the property, setting the size of the view should be put here.

    2. initSubviews()

    The constructor then call this method. Every subclass should use this method to create subviews.

    Creating, Modifying, Layouting the subviews should be put here.

    3. initEvents()

    The constructor finally call this method. It's time to link the events.

    Author:
    Zhe Zhao
    See Also:

    • Method Detail

      • init

        protected void init()

      • initSubviews

        protected void initSubviews()
        An method will be called when contracting the view object. Any code related to creating or modifying a view should be put in here.

      • initEvents

        protected void initEvents()
        An method will be called when contracting the view object. When you want to add event listener to a subview, you should put the code here. This method will be called right after initSubviews
